class.name: boundary_condition
class.description: A boundary condition is a numerical requirement which looks like a variable imposed on the model evolution (i.e. it might - or might not - evolve with time, but is seen by the model at various times during its evolution) as opposed to an initial condition (at model time zero).

attribute.name: requirement_type
attribute.description: Type of reqirement to which the experiment must conform.

class.name: conformance
class.description: A conformance class maps how a configured model component met a specific numerical requirement. For example, for a double CO2 boundary condition, a model component might read a CO2 dataset in which CO2 has been doubled, or it might modify a parameterisation (presumably with a factor of two somewhere). So, the conformance links a requirement to a DataSource (which can be either an actual DataObject or a property of a model component). In some cases a model/simulation may _naturally_ conform to a requirement. In this case there would be no reference to a DataSource but the conformant attribute would be true. If something is purpopsefully non-conformant then the conformant attribute would be false.

attribute.name: is_conformant
attribute.description: Records whether or not this conformance satisfies the requirement. A simulation should have at least one conformance mapping to every experimental requirement. If a simulation satisfies the requirement - the usual case - then conformant should have a value of true. If conformant is true but there is no reference to a source for the conformance, then we can assume that the simulation conforms to the requirement _naturally_, that is without having to modify code or inputs. If a simulation does not conform to a requirement then conformant should be set to false.

attribute.name: requirements
attribute.description: Points to the NumericalRequirement that the simulation in question is conforming to.

attribute.name: sources
attribute.description: Points to the DataSource used to conform to a particular Requirement. This may be part of an activity::simulation or a software::component. It can be either a DataObject or a SoftwareComponent or a ComponentProperty. It could also be by using particular attributes of, say, a SoftwareComponent, but in that case the recommended practise is to reference the component and add appropriate text in the conformance description attribute.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Describes the method that this simulation conforms to an experimental requirement (in case it is not specified by the change property of the reference to the source of this conformance)

class.name: ensemble
class.description: An ensemble is made up of two or more simulations which are to be compared against each other to create ensemble statistics. Ensemble members can differ in terms of initial conditions, physical parameterisation and the model used. An ensemble bundles together sets of ensembleMembers, all of which reference the same Simulation(Run) and include one or more changes.

attribute.name: outputs
attribute.description: Points to the DataSource used to conform to a particular Requirement. This may be part of an activity::simulation or a software::component. It can be either a DataObject or a SoftwareComponent or a ComponentProperty. It could also be by using particular attributes of, say, a SoftwareComponent, but in that case the recommended practise is to reference the component and add appropriate text in the conformance description attribute.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the experiment.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is recognized externally).

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is used internally).

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this activity.

attribute.name: projects
attribute.description: The project(s) that this activity is associated with (ie: CMIP5, AMIP, etc).

attribute.name: rationales
attribute.description: For what purpose is this activity being performed?

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: The point of contact(s) for this activity.This includes, among others, the principle investigator.

class.name: ensemble_member
class.description: A simulation is the implementation of a numerical experiment. A simulation can be made up of "child" simulations aggregated together to form a "simulation composite". The "parent" simulation can be made up of whole or partial child simulations, the simulation attributes need to be able to capture this.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the experiment.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is recognized externally).

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is used internally).

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this activity.

attribute.name: projects
attribute.description: The project(s) that this activity is associated with (ie: CMIP5, AMIP, etc).

attribute.name: rationales
attribute.description: For what purpose is this activity being performed?

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: The point of contact(s) for this activity.This includes, among others, the principle investigator.

class.name: experiment_relationship
class.description: Contains a set of relationship types specific to a experiment document that can be used to describe its genealogy.

class.name: experiment_relationship_target
class.description: Creates and returns instance of experiment_relationship_target class.

class.name: initial_condition
class.description: An initial condition is a numerical requirement on a model prognostic variable value at time zero.

attribute.name: requirement_type
attribute.description: Type of reqirement to which the experiment must conform.

class.name: lateral_boundary_condition
class.description: A boundary condition is a numerical requirement which looks like a variable imposed on the model evolution (i.e. it might - or might not - evolve with time, but is seen by the model at various times during its evolution) as opposed to an initial condition (at model time zero).

attribute.name: requirement_type
attribute.description: Type of reqirement to which the experiment must conform.

class.name: measurement_campaign
class.description: Creates and returns instance of measurement_campaign class.

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this activity.

attribute.name: projects
attribute.description: The project(s) that this activity is associated with (ie: CMIP5, AMIP, etc).

attribute.name: rationales
attribute.description: For what purpose is this activity being performed?

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: The point of contact(s) for this activity.This includes, among others, the principle investigator.

class.name: numerical_experiment
class.description: A numerical experiment may be generated by an experiment, in which case it is inSupportOf the experiment. But a numerical experiment may also exist as an activity in its own right (as it might be if it were needed for a MIP). Examples: AR4 individual experiments, AR5 individual experiments, RAPID THC experiments etc.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the experiment.

attribute.name: experiment_id
attribute.description: An experiment ID takes the form <number>.<number>[-<letter>].

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is recognized externally).

attribute.name: requirements
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is used internally).

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is used internally).

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this activity.

attribute.name: projects
attribute.description: The project(s) that this activity is associated with (ie: CMIP5, AMIP, etc).

attribute.name: rationales
attribute.description: For what purpose is this activity being performed?

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: The point of contact(s) for this activity.This includes, among others, the principle investigator.

class.name: numerical_requirement_option
class.description: A NumericalRequirement that is being used as a set of related requirements; For example if a requirement is to use 1 of 3 boundary conditions, then that "parent" requirement would have three "child" RequirmentOptions (each of one with the XOR optionRelationship).

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: Describes how this optional (child) requirement is related to its sibling requirements. For example, a NumericalRequirement could consist of a set of optional requirements each with an "OR" relationship meaning use this boundary condition _or_ that one.

class.name: output_requirement
class.description: Contains a set of relationship types specific to a simulation document that can be used to describe its genealogy.

attribute.name: requirement_type
attribute.description: Type of reqirement to which the experiment must conform.

class.name: physical_modification
class.description: Physical modification is the implementation of a boundary condition numerical requirement that is achieved within the model code rather than from some external source file. It might include, for example, a specific rate constant within a chemical reaction, or coefficient value(s) in a parameterisation. For example, one might require a numerical experiment where specific chemical reactions were turned off - e.g. no heterogeneous chemistry.

attribute.name: is_conformant
attribute.description: Records whether or not this conformance satisfies the requirement. A simulation should have at least one conformance mapping to every experimental requirement. If a simulation satisfies the requirement - the usual case - then conformant should have a value of true. If conformant is true but there is no reference to a source for the conformance, then we can assume that the simulation conforms to the requirement _naturally_, that is without having to modify code or inputs. If a simulation does not conform to a requirement then conformant should be set to false.

attribute.name: requirements
attribute.description: Points to the NumericalRequirement that the simulation in question is conforming to.

attribute.name: sources
attribute.description: Points to the DataSource used to conform to a particular Requirement. This may be part of an activity::simulation or a software::component. It can be either a DataObject or a SoftwareComponent or a ComponentProperty. It could also be by using particular attributes of, say, a SoftwareComponent, but in that case the recommended practise is to reference the component and add appropriate text in the conformance description attribute.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Describes the method that this simulation conforms to an experimental requirement (in case it is not specified by the change property of the reference to the source of this conformance)

class.name: simulation_composite
class.description: A SimulationComposite is an aggregation of Simulations. With the aggreation connector between Simulation and SimulationComposite(SC) the SC can be made up of both SimulationRuns and SCs. The SimulationComposite is the new name for the concept of SimulationCollection: A simulation can be made up of "child" simulations aggregated together to form a "simulation composite". The "parent" simulation can be made up of whole or partial child simulations and the SimulationComposite attributes need to be able to capture this.

attribute.name: rank
attribute.description: Position of a simulation in the SimulationComposite timeline. eg: Is this the first (rank = 1) or second (rank = 2) simulation

attribute.name: authors
attribute.description: List of associated authors.

attribute.name: control_simulation
attribute.description: Points to a simulation being used as the basis (control) run. Note that only "derived" simulations can describe something as being control; a simulation should not know if it is being used itself as the control of some other run.

attribute.name: inputs
attribute.description: Implemented as a mapping from a source to target; can be a forcing file, a boundary condition, etc.

attribute.name: spinup_date_range
attribute.description: The date range that a simulation is engaged in spinup.

attribute.name: spinup_simulation
attribute.description: The (external) simulation used during "spinup." Note that this element can be used in conjuntion with spinupDateRange. If a simulation has the latter but not the former, then one can assume that the simulation is performing its own spinup.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the experiment.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is recognized externally).

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is used internally).

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this activity.

attribute.name: projects
attribute.description: The project(s) that this activity is associated with (ie: CMIP5, AMIP, etc).

attribute.name: rationales
attribute.description: For what purpose is this activity being performed?

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: The point of contact(s) for this activity.This includes, among others, the principle investigator.

class.name: simulation_relationship
class.description: Contains a set of relationship types specific to a simulation document that can be used to describe its genealogy.

class.name: simulation_relationship_target
class.description: Creates and returns instance of simulation_relationship_target class.

class.name: simulation_run
class.description: A SimulationRun is, as the name implies, one single model run. A SimulationRun is a Simulation. There is a one to one association between SimulationRun and (a top-level) SoftwarePackage::ModelComponent.

attribute.name: authors
attribute.description: List of associated authors.

attribute.name: control_simulation
attribute.description: Points to a simulation being used as the basis (control) run. Note that only "derived" simulations can describe something as being control; a simulation should not know if it is being used itself as the control of some other run.

attribute.name: inputs
attribute.description: Implemented as a mapping from a source to target; can be a forcing file, a boundary condition, etc.

attribute.name: spinup_date_range
attribute.description: The date range that a simulation is engaged in spinup.

attribute.name: spinup_simulation
attribute.description: The (external) simulation used during "spinup." Note that this element can be used in conjuntion with spinupDateRange. If a simulation has the latter but not the former, then one can assume that the simulation is performing its own spinup.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the experiment.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is recognized externally).

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: The name of the experiment (that is used internally).

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this activity.

attribute.name: projects
attribute.description: The project(s) that this activity is associated with (ie: CMIP5, AMIP, etc).

attribute.name: rationales
attribute.description: For what purpose is this activity being performed?

attribute.name: responsible_parties
attribute.description: The point of contact(s) for this activity.This includes, among others, the principle investigator.

class.name: spatio_temporal_constraint
class.description: Contains a set of relationship types specific to a simulation document that can be used to describe its genealogy.

attribute.name: requirement_type
attribute.description: Type of reqirement to which the experiment must conform.

class.name: data_content
class.description: The contents of the data object; like ISO: MD_ContentInformation.

attribute.name: aggregation
attribute.description: Describes how the content has been aggregated together: sum, min, mean, max, ...

attribute.name: frequency
attribute.description: Describes the frequency of the data content: daily, hourly, ...

class.name: data_distribution
class.description: Describes how a DataObject is distributed.

class.name: data_extent
class.description: A data object extent represents the geographical and temporal coverage associated with a data object.

class.name: data_extent_geographical
class.description: A data object geographical extent represents the geographical coverage associated with a data object.

class.name: data_extent_temporal
class.description: A data object temporal extent represents the temporal coverage associated with a data object.

class.name: data_extent_time_interval
class.description: A data object temporal extent represents the temporal coverage associated with a data object.

class.name: data_hierarchy_level
class.description: The type of data object that is grouped together into a particular hierarchy. Currently, this is made up of terms describing how the Met Office splits up archived data and how THREDDS categorises variables.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: What level in the data hierarchy (constructed by the self-referential parent/child aggregations) is this DataObject.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: What is the name of the specific HierarchyLevel this DataObject is being organised at (ie: if the HierarchyLevel is "run" then the name might be the runid).

class.name: data_object
class.description: A DataObject describes a unit of data. DataObjects can be grouped hierarchically. The attributes hierarchyLevelName and hierarchyLevelValue describe how objects are grouped.

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: The content of a DataObject corresponds to a variable (in THREDDS, ...etc.)

class.name: data_property
class.description: A property of a DataObject. Currently this is intended to be used to record CF specific information (like packing, scaling, etc.) for OASIS4.

class.name: data_restriction
class.description: An access or use restriction on some element of the DataObject actual data.

attribute.name: license
attribute.description: The thing (data or metadata, access or use) that this restriction is applied to.

attribute.name: restriction
attribute.description: The thing (data or metadata, access or use) that this restriction is applied to.

attribute.name: scope
attribute.description: The thing (data or metadata, access or use) that this restriction is applied to.

class.name: data_storage_db
class.description: Contains attributes to describe a DataObject stored as a database file.

class.name: data_storage_file
class.description: Contains attributes to describe a DataObject stored as a single file.

class.name: data_storage_ip
class.description: Contains attributes to describe a DataObject stored as a database file.

class.name: data_topic
class.description: Describes the content of a data object: the variable name, units, etc.

class.name: coordinate_list
class.description: The CoordList type may be used to specify a list of coordinates, typically for the purpose of defining coordinates along the X, Y or Z axes. The length of the coordinate list is given by the attribute of that name. This may be used by software to allocate memory in advance of storing the coordinate values. The hasConstantOffset attribute may be used to indicate that the coordinate list consists of values with constant offset (spacing). In this case only the first coordinate value and the offset (spacing) value need to be specified; however, the length attribute must still define the final as-built size of the coordinate list.

attribute.name: has_constant_offset
attribute.description: Set to true if coordinates in the built array have constant offset.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: Specifies the length of the coordinate array. This should always be the final, as-built length of the array if the hasConstantOffset property is set to true and the compact notation (start coordinate plus offset) is used.

attribute.name: uom
attribute.description: Units of measure used by the coordinates.

class.name: grid_extent
class.description: DataType for recording the geographic extent of a gridMosaic or gridTile.

class.name: grid_mosaic
class.description: The GridMosaic class is used to define the geometry properties of an earth system model grid or an exchange grid. Such a grid definition may then be referenced by any number of earth system models. A GridMosaic object consists either of 1 or more child GridMosaics, or one or more child GridTiles, but not both. In the latter case the isLeaf property should be set to true, indicating that the mosaic is a leaf mosaic.

attribute.name: citations
attribute.description: Optional container element for specifying a list of references that describe the grid.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of a grid mosaic.

attribute.name: has_congruent_tiles
attribute.description: Indicates whether or not all the tiles contained within a grid mosaic are congruent, that is, of the same size and shape.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Specifies a globally unique identifier for a grid mosaic instance. By globally we mean across all GridSpec instances/records within a given modelling activity (such as CMIP5).

attribute.name: is_leaf
attribute.description: Indicates whether or not a grid mosaic is a leaf mosaic, that is, it only contains child grid tiles not further mosaics.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: Specifies the long name associated with a grid mosaic. The long name will typically be a human-readable string, with acronyms expanded, used for labelling purposes.

attribute.name: mosaic_count
attribute.description: Specifies the number of mosaics associated with a non-leaf grid mosaic. Set to zero if the grid mosaic is a leaf mosaic, i.e. it contains child grid tiles not mosaics.

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: Specifies the short name associated with a grid mosaic. The short name will typically be a convenient abbreviation used to refer to a grid mosaic, e.g. 'UM ATM N96'.

attribute.name: tile_count
attribute.description: Specifies the number of tiles associated with a leaf grid mosaic. Set to zero if the grid mosaic is not a leaf mosaic, i.e. it contains child grid mosaics rather than tiles. (Added to align with equivalent ESG/Curator property.)

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Specifies the type of all the grid tiles contained in a grid mosaic. It is assumed that all of the tiles comprising a given grid mosaic are of the same type. The value domain is as per the specified enumeration list.

class.name: grid_property
class.description: Creates and returns instance of grid_property class.

class.name: grid_spec
class.description: This is a container class for GridSpec objects. A GridSpec object can contain one or more esmModelGrid objects, and one or more esmExchangeGrid objects. These objects may be serialised to one or possibly several files according to taste. Since GridSpec is sub-typed from GML's AbstractGeometryType it can, and should, be identified using a gml:id attribute.

class.name: grid_tile
class.description: The GridTile class is used to model an individual grid tile contained within a grid mosaic. A GridTile consists of an array of grid cells which may be defined in one of four ways: 1) for simple grids, by use of the SimpleGridGeometry data type; 2) by defining an array of GridCell objects; 3) by specifying an array of references to externally defined GridCell objects; or 4) by specifying a URI to a remote data file containing the grid cell definitions. For all but the simplest grid tiles, it is envisaged that method 4 above will be the most frequently used option. However, it should be remembered that the CIM is primarily concerned with encoding climate model metadata. Specifying the coordinates of individual grid tiles and cells will most likely not be required as part of such metadata descriptions. A GridTile object is associated with a geodetic or projected CRS via the horizontalCRS property, and with a vertical CRS via the verticalCRS property.

attribute.name: area
attribute.description: gml:MeasureType:Specifies the area of the grid tile in the units defined by the uom attribute that is attached to the GML MeasureType data type.

attribute.name: cell_array
attribute.description: GridCellArray:This property may be used to specify an array of grid cell definitions which together define the coordinate geometry of a grid tile. Depending on context, any of the existing sub-types of GridCell may be used. Mixing types is, however, not currently permitted.

attribute.name: cell_ref_array
attribute.description: GridCellArray:This property may be used to define the coordinate geometry of a grid tile by specifying an array of references to remotely defined grid cells. Depending on context, any of the existing sub-types of GridCell may be referenced.

attribute.name: coord_file
attribute.description: This property may be used to specify the URI of a file containing grid coordinates that define the geometry of a a grid tile. It is envisaged that this will be the preferred mechanism for specifying the geometry of complex grids.

attribute.name: coordinate_pole
attribute.description: gml:PointType:The coordinatePole property may be used to specify the lat-long position of any coordinate poles (in the mathematical sense) that form part of the definition of a grid tile. Not to be confused with the gridNorthPole property. If required, two or more coordinate pole definitions may be distinguished by setting the gml:id attribute to appropriate values, such as spole, npole, etc.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of a grid tile.

attribute.name: discretization_type
attribute.description: Indicates the type of discretization applied to the grid tile, e.g. "logically_rectangular".

attribute.name: geometry_type
attribute.description: Indicates the geometric figure used to approximate the figure of the Earth, e.g. "sphere".

attribute.name: grid_north_pole
attribute.description: gml:PointType:If required, defines the lat-long position of the north pole used by the grid tile in the case of rotated/displaced pole grids. Not to be confused with the coordinatePole property.

attribute.name: horizontal_crs
attribute.description: gml:CRSPropertyType:Specifies the horizontal coordinate reference system used in the definition of the grid tile coordinates. This property should normally be an xlink reference to an external horizontal CRS definition (e.g. in a separate CRS dictionary). If required, however, the property may be defined in situ within a CIM document.

attribute.name: horizontal_resolution
attribute.description: Provides an indication of the approximate spatial sampling size of the grid tile, i.e. the size of the underlying grid cells. (Note: the maximum spatial resolution of the grid is twice the sampling size (e.g. 2 km for a 1 km x 1 km grid pitch).

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Specifies an identifer for a grid tile that is unique within its parent grid mosaic. It is not required for this identifier to be unique either across all mosaics in a GridSpec or across all GridSpecs, though if that were the case it would not be detrimental.

attribute.name: is_conformal
attribute.description: This property is used to indicate if the grid tile is conformal, i.e. angle-preserving. If so, angles measured on the grid are equal to the equivalent angles on the Earth.

attribute.name: is_regular
attribute.description: If true, indicates that the horizontal coordinates of the grid can be defined using 1D arrays (vectors). This means that grid node locations are defined by the cartesian product of the X/Lon and Y/Lat coordinate vectors. It also means that grid cells are logically rectangular (they may also be physically rectangular in the case of projected coordinates).

attribute.name: is_terrain_following
attribute.description: Set to true if the vertical coordinate system is terrain-following even if, as is often the case, this only applies to the lower levels of the grid.

attribute.name: is_uniform
attribute.description: If true, indicates that horizontal coordinates have fixed offsets in the X and Y directions. If the offset is the same in both directions then the grids are logically square, otherwise they are logically rectangular. The offsets can be specified by two scalar values (or three values in the case of 3D grids).

attribute.name: nx
attribute.description: Specifies the length of the X, or longitude, dimension of the grid tile.

attribute.name: ny
attribute.description: Specifies the length of the Y, or latitude, dimension of the grid tile.

attribute.name: nz
attribute.description: Specifies the length of the Z, or height/level, dimension of the grid tile. The zcoords coordinate list property, if specified, should have this length.

attribute.name: simple_grid_geom
attribute.description: SimpleGridGeometry:This property may be used to define the coordinates of the nodes or cells making up a simple (i.e. uniform or regular) grid tile. More details are provided in the description of the SimpleGridGeometry data type.

attribute.name: vertical_crs
attribute.description: gml:CRSPropertyType:Specifies the vertical coordinate reference system used in the definition of the grid tile coordinates. This property should normally be an xlink reference to an external vertical CRS definition (e.g. in a separate CRS dictionary). If required, however, the property may be defined in situ within a CIM document.

attribute.name: vertical_resolution
attribute.description: Provides an indication of the approximate resolution of the grid tile in the vertical dimension. (Added to align with corresponding ESG/Curator and DIF property).

attribute.name: zcoords
attribute.description: This optional property may be used to specify the vertical coordinates (e.g. heights or model levels) at which a grid tile is utilised or realised. In the case of simple grid tiles the equivalent zcoords property on the SimpleGridGeometry data type would be used instead. The current property is intended to be used when the horizontal grid coordinates are defined by one of the other methods.

class.name: grid_tile_resolution_type
class.description: Provides a description and set of named properties for the horizontal or vertical resolution.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A description of the resolution.

class.name: simple_grid_geometry
class.description: SimpleGridGeometry:This property may be used to define the coordinates of the nodes or cells making up a simple (i.e. uniform or regular) grid tile. More details are provided in the description of the SimpleGridGeometry data type.

attribute.name: xcoords
attribute.description: X-Co-ordinates

attribute.name: ycoords
attribute.description: Y-Co-ordinates

attribute.name: zcoords
attribute.description: Z-Co-ordinates

class.name: vertical_coordinate_list
class.description: There are some specific attributes that are associated with vertical coordinates.

attribute.name: form
attribute.description: Units of measure used by the coordinates.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Specifies the length of the coordinate array. This should always be the final, as-built length of the array if the hasConstantOffset property is set to true and the compact notation (start coordinate plus offset) is used.

attribute.name: has_constant_offset
attribute.description: Set to true if coordinates in the built array have constant offset.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: Specifies the length of the coordinate array. This should always be the final, as-built length of the array if the hasConstantOffset property is set to true and the compact notation (start coordinate plus offset) is used.

attribute.name: uom
attribute.description: Units of measure used by the coordinates.

class.name: document_set
class.description: Represents a bundled set of documents.

attribute.name: data
attribute.description: Associated input/output data.

attribute.name: ensembles
attribute.description: Associated ensemble runs.

attribute.name: experiment
attribute.description: Associated numerical experiment.

attribute.name: grids
attribute.description: Associated grid-spec.

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: Associated model component.

attribute.name: platform
attribute.description: Associated simulation execution platform.

attribute.name: simulation
attribute.description: Associated simulation run.

class.name: cim_quality
class.description: The starting point for a quality record. It can contain any number of issues and reports. An issue is an open-ended description of some issue about a CIM instance. A record is a prescribed description of some specific quantitative measure that has been applied to a CIM instance.

class.name: evaluation
class.description: Creates and returns instance of evaluation class.

class.name: measure
class.description: Creates and returns instance of measure class.

class.name: report
class.description: Creates and returns instance of report class.

class.name: change
class.description: A description of [a set of] changes applied at a particular time, by a particular party, to a particular unit of metadata.

attribute.name: author
attribute.description: The person that made the change.

attribute.name: date
attribute.description: The date the change was implemented.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: A mnemonic for describing a particular change.

class.name: change_property
class.description: A description of a single change applied to a single target. Every ChangeProperty has a description, and may also have a name from a controlled vocabulary and a value.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A text description of the change. May be used in addition to, or instead of, the more formal description provided by the "value" attribute.

class.name: citation
class.description: An academic reference to published work.

class.name: closed_date_range
class.description: A date range with specified start and end points.

attribute.name: end
attribute.description: End date is optional becuase the length of a ClosedDateRange can be calculated from the StartDate plus the Duration element.

class.name: compiler
class.description: A description of a compiler used on a particular platform.

attribute.name: environment_variables
attribute.description: The set of environment_variables used during compilation (recorded here as a single string rather than separate elements)

attribute.name: options
attribute.description: The set of options used during compilation (recorded here as a single string rather than separate elements)

class.name: daily_360
class.description: Creates and returns instance of daily_360 class.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Describes the finer details of the calendar, in case they are not-obvious. For example, if an experiment has changing conditions within it (ie: 1% CO2 increase until 2100, then hold fixed for the remaining period of the experment)

class.name: doc_reference
class.description: A reference to another cim entity.

attribute.name: changes
attribute.description: An optional description of how the item being referenced has been modified. This is particularly useful for dealing with Ensembles (a set of simulations where something about each simulation has changed) or Conformances.

attribute.name: constraint_vocabulary
attribute.description: A constraint vocabulary for the relationship.

attribute.name: context
attribute.description: Information about remote record in context of reference.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Detail of how to access the resource.

attribute.name: external_id
attribute.description: External identifier of remote resource, if known.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Identifier of remote resource, if known.

attribute.name: institute
attribute.description: Canonical institute name of referenced document.

attribute.name: linkage
attribute.description: A URL.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of online resource.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: Protocol to use at the linkage.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: Predicate - relationship of the object target as seen from the subject resource.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of remote document.

attribute.name: url
attribute.description: The URL of the remote document.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: The version of the remote document.

class.name: license
class.description: A description of a license restricting access to a unit of data or software.

attribute.name: contact
attribute.description: The point of contact for access to this artifact; may be either a person or an institution.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A textual description of the license; might be the full text of the license, more likely to be a brief summary

attribute.name: is_unrestricted
attribute.description: If unrestricted="true" then the artifact can be downloaded with no restrictions (ie: there are no administrative steps for the user to deal with; code or data can be downloaded and used directly).

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name that the license goes by (ie: "GPL")

class.name: machine
class.description: A description of a machine used by a particular platform.

attribute.name: libraries
attribute.description: The libraries residing on this machine.

class.name: machine_compiler_unit
class.description: Associates a machine with a [set of] compilers. This is a separate class in case a platform needs to specify more than one machine/compiler pair.

class.name: open_date_range
class.description: A date range without a specified start and/or end point.

class.name: perpetual_period
class.description: Creates and returns instance of perpetual_period class.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Describes the finer details of the calendar, in case they are not-obvious. For example, if an experiment has changing conditions within it (ie: 1% CO2 increase until 2100, then hold fixed for the remaining period of the experment)

class.name: platform
class.description: A platform is a description of resources used to deploy a component/simulation. A platform pairs a machine with a (set of) compilers. There is also a point of contact for the platform.

class.name: property
class.description: A simple name/value pair representing a property of some entity or other.

class.name: real_calendar
class.description: Creates and returns instance of real_calendar class.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Describes the finer details of the calendar, in case they are not-obvious. For example, if an experiment has changing conditions within it (ie: 1% CO2 increase until 2100, then hold fixed for the remaining period of the experment)

class.name: responsible_party
class.description: A person/organsiation responsible for some aspect of a climate science artefact.

class.name: standard
class.description: Describes a name given to an entity from a recognised standard. The CIM records the standard and the name. For example, the standard might be CF and the name might be atmospheric_pressure.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The version of the standard

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the standard

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: The version of the standard

class.name: standard_name
class.description: Describes a name given to an entity from a recognised standard. The CIM records the standard and the name. For example, the standard might be CF and the name might be atmospheric_pressure.

attribute.name: standards
attribute.description: Details of the standard being used.

class.name: component
class.description: A SofwareComponent is an abstract component from which all other components derive. It represents an element that takes input data and generates output data. A SoftwareCompnent can include nested "child" components. Every component can have "componentProperties" which describe the scientific properties that a component simulates (for example, temperature, pressure, etc.) and the numerical properties that influence how a component performs its simulation (for example, the force of gravity). A SoftwareComponent can also have a Deployment, which describes how software is deployed onto computing resources. And a SoftwareComponent can have a composition, which describes how ComponentProperties are coupled together either to/from other SoftwareComponents or external data files. The properties specified by a component's composition must be owned by that component or a child of that component; child components cannot couple together their parents' properties.

attribute.name: code_access
attribute.description: Instructions on how to access the source code for this component.

attribute.name: coupling_framework
attribute.description: The coupling framework that this entire component conforms to.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the component.

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this software component.

attribute.name: grid
attribute.description: A reference to the grid that is used by this component.

attribute.name: is_embedded
attribute.description: An embedded component cannot exist on its own as an atomic piece of software; instead it is embedded within another (parent) component. When embedded equals "true", the SoftwareComponent has a corresponding piece of software (otherwise it is acting as a "virtual" component which may be inexorably nested within a piece of software along with several other virtual components).

attribute.name: license
attribute.description: The license held by this piece of software.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: The name of the model (that is recognized externally).

attribute.name: online_resource
attribute.description: Provides a URL location for this model.

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: The properties that this model simulates and/or couples.

attribute.name: release_date
attribute.description: The date of publication of the software component code (as opposed to the date of publication of the metadata document, or the date of deployment of the model)

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: The name of the model (that is used internally).

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A free text description of the component version #.

class.name: component_language
class.description: Details of the programming language a component is written in. There is an assumption that all EntryPoints use the same ComponentLanguage.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the language.

class.name: component_language_property
class.description: This provides a place to include language-specific information. Every property is basically a name/value pair, where the names are things like: moduleName, reservedUnits, reservedNames (these are all examples of Fortran-specific properties).

class.name: component_property
class.description: ComponentProperties include things that a component simulates (ie: pressure, humidity) and things that prescribe that simulation (ie: gravity, choice of advection scheme). Note that this is a specialisation of shared::DataSource. data::DataObject is also a specialisation of shared::DataSource. This allows software::Connections and/or activity::Conformance to refer to either ComponentProperties or DataObjects.

attribute.name: grid
attribute.description: A reference to the grid that is used by this component.

attribute.name: intent
attribute.description: The direction that this property is intended to be coupled: in, out, or inout.

attribute.name: is_represented
attribute.description: When set to false, means that this property is not used by the component. Covers the case when, for instance, a modeler chooses not to represent some property in their model. (But still allows meaningful comparisons between components which _do_ model this property.)

attribute.name: units
attribute.description: The standard name that this property is known as (for example, its CF name).

attribute.name: values
attribute.description: The value of the property (not applicable to fields).

class.name: composition
class.description: The set of Couplings used by a Component. Couplings can only occur between child components. That is, a composition must belong to an ancestor component of the components whose fields are being connected.

class.name: connection
class.description: A Connection represents a link from a source DataSource to a target DataSource. These can either be ComponentProperties (ie: the values come from an internal component) or DataObjects (ie: the values come from an external file). It can be associated with another software component (a transformer). If present, the rate, lag, timeTransformation, and spatialRegridding override that of the parent coupling. Note that there is the potential for multiple connectionSource & connectionTarget and multiple couplingSources & couplingTargets. This may lead users to wonder how to match up a connection source (a ComponentProperty) with its coupling source (a SoftwareComponent). Clever logic is not required though; because the sources and targets are listed by reference, they can be found in a CIM document and the parent can be navigated to from there - there is no need to consult the source or target of the coupling.

attribute.name: priming
attribute.description: A priming source is one that is active on the first available timestep only (before "proper" coupling can ocurr). It can either be described here explicitly, or else a separate coupling/connection with a timing profile that is active on only the first timestep can be created.

attribute.name: sources
attribute.description: The source property being connected. (note that there can be multiple sources) This is optional; the file/component source may have already been specified by the couplingSource.

attribute.name: spatial_regridding
attribute.description: Characteristics of the scheme used to interpolate a field from one grid (source grid) to another (target grid)

attribute.name: target
attribute.description: The target property being connected. This is optional to support the way that input is handled in the CMIP5 questionnaire.

attribute.name: time_lag
attribute.description: The coupling field used in the target at a given time corresponds to a field produced by the source at a previous time.

attribute.name: time_profile
attribute.description: All information having to do with the rate of this connection; the times that it is active. This overrides any rate of a Coupling.

attribute.name: time_transformation
attribute.description: Temporal transformation performed on the coupling field before or after regridding onto the target grid.

attribute.name: transformers
attribute.description: An "in-line" transformer. This references a fully-described transformer (typically that forms part of the top-level composition) used in the context of this coupling. It is used instead of separately specifying a spatialRegridding, timeTransformation, etc. here.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of Connection

class.name: connection_endpoint
class.description: The source/target of a coupling. This is a DataSource (a SoftwareComponent or DataObject). This is a separate class in order to associate an instanceID with the DataSource; this is used to identify which particular instance is being coupled in case the same DataSource is used more than once in a coupled model (this may be required for BFG).

attribute.name: instance_id
attribute.description: If the same datasource is used more than once in a coupled model then a method for identifying which particular instance is being referenced is needed (for BFG).

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: The place to describe features specific to the source/target of a connection.

class.name: connection_property
class.description: A ConnectionProperty is a name/value pair used to specify OASIS-specific properties.

class.name: coupling
class.description: A coupling represents a set of Connections between a source and target component. Couplings can be complete or incomplete. If they are complete then they must include all Connections between model properties. If they are incomplete then the connections can be underspecified or not listed at all.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the coupling.

attribute.name: is_fully_specified
attribute.description: If true then the coupling is fully-specified. If false then not every Connection has been described within the coupling.

attribute.name: priming
attribute.description: A priming source is one that is active on the first available timestep only (before "proper" coupling can ocurr). It can either be described here explicitly, or else a separate coupling/connection with a timing profile that is active on only the first timestep can be created.

attribute.name: sources
attribute.description: The source component of the coupling. (note that there can be multiple sources).

attribute.name: spatial_regriddings
attribute.description: Characteristics of the scheme used to interpolate a field from one grid (source grid) to another (target grid).

attribute.name: target
attribute.description: The target component of the coupling.

attribute.name: time_lag
attribute.description: The coupling field used in the target at a given time corresponds to a field produced by the source at a previous time.

attribute.name: time_profile
attribute.description: Describes how often the coupling takes place.

attribute.name: time_transformation
attribute.description: Temporal transformation performed on the coupling field before or after regridding onto the target grid.

attribute.name: transformers
attribute.description: An "in-line" transformer. This references a fully-described transformer (typically that forms part of the top-level composition) used in the context of this coupling. It is used instead of separately specifying a spatialRegridding, timeTransformation, etc. here.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Describes the method of coupling.

class.name: coupling_endpoint
class.description: The source/target of a coupling. This is a DataSource (a SoftwareComponent or DataObject). This is a separate class in order to associate an instanceID with the DataSource; this is used to identify which particular instance is being coupled in case the same DataSource is used more than once in a coupled model (this may be required for BFG).

attribute.name: instance_id
attribute.description: If the same datasource is used more than once in a coupled model then a method for identifying which particular instance is being referenced is needed (for BFG).

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: A place to describe features specific to the source/target of a coupling

class.name: coupling_property
class.description: A CouplingProperty is a name/value pair used to specify OASIS-specific properties.

class.name: deployment
class.description: Gives information about the technical properties of a component: what machine it was run on, which compilers were used, how it was parallised, etc. A deployment basically associates a deploymentDate with a Platform. A deployment only exists if something has been deployed. A platform, in contrast, can exist independently, waiting to be used in deployments.

attribute.name: platform
attribute.description: The platform that this deployment has been run on. It is optional to allow for "unconfigured" models, that nonetheless specify their parallelisation constraints (a feature needed by OASIS).

class.name: entry_point
class.description: Describes a function or subroutine of a SoftwareComponent. BFG will use these EntryPoints to define a schedule of subroutine calls for a coupled model. Currently, a very basic schedule can be approximated by using the "proceeds" and "follows" attributes, however a more complete system is required for full BFG compatibility. Every EntryPoint can have a set of arguments associated with it. These reference (previously defined) ComponentProperties.

class.name: model_component
class.description: A ModelComponent is a scientific model; it represents code which models some physical phenomena for a particular length of time.

attribute.name: timing
attribute.description: Describes information about how this component simulates time.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Describes the type of component. There can be multiple types.

attribute.name: types
attribute.description: Describes the type of component. There can be multiple types.

attribute.name: code_access
attribute.description: Instructions on how to access the source code for this component.

attribute.name: coupling_framework
attribute.description: The coupling framework that this entire component conforms to.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the component.

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this software component.

attribute.name: grid
attribute.description: A reference to the grid that is used by this component.

attribute.name: is_embedded
attribute.description: An embedded component cannot exist on its own as an atomic piece of software; instead it is embedded within another (parent) component. When embedded equals "true", the SoftwareComponent has a corresponding piece of software (otherwise it is acting as a "virtual" component which may be inexorably nested within a piece of software along with several other virtual components).

attribute.name: license
attribute.description: The license held by this piece of software.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: The name of the model (that is recognized externally).

attribute.name: online_resource
attribute.description: Provides a URL location for this model.

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: The properties that this model simulates and/or couples.

attribute.name: release_date
attribute.description: The date of publication of the software component code (as opposed to the date of publication of the metadata document, or the date of deployment of the model)

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: The name of the model (that is used internally).

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A free text description of the component version #.

class.name: parallelisation
class.description: Describes how a deployment has been parallelised across a computing platform.

class.name: processor_component
class.description: A ModelComponent is a scientific model; it represents code which models some physical phenomena for a particular length of time.

attribute.name: code_access
attribute.description: Instructions on how to access the source code for this component.

attribute.name: coupling_framework
attribute.description: The coupling framework that this entire component conforms to.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the component.

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this software component.

attribute.name: grid
attribute.description: A reference to the grid that is used by this component.

attribute.name: is_embedded
attribute.description: An embedded component cannot exist on its own as an atomic piece of software; instead it is embedded within another (parent) component. When embedded equals "true", the SoftwareComponent has a corresponding piece of software (otherwise it is acting as a "virtual" component which may be inexorably nested within a piece of software along with several other virtual components).

attribute.name: license
attribute.description: The license held by this piece of software.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: The name of the model (that is recognized externally).

attribute.name: online_resource
attribute.description: Provides a URL location for this model.

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: The properties that this model simulates and/or couples.

attribute.name: release_date
attribute.description: The date of publication of the software component code (as opposed to the date of publication of the metadata document, or the date of deployment of the model)

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: The name of the model (that is used internally).

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A free text description of the component version #.

class.name: rank
class.description: Creates and returns instance of rank class.

class.name: spatial_regridding
class.description: Characteristics of the scheme used to interpolate a field from one grid (source grid) to another (target grid). Documents should use either the spatialRegriddingStandardMethod _or_ the spatialRegriddingUserMethod, but not both.

class.name: spatial_regridding_property
class.description: Used for OASIS-specific regridding information (ie: masked, order, normalisation, etc.)

class.name: spatial_regridding_user_method
class.description: Characteristics of the scheme used to interpolate a field from one grid (source grid) to another (target grid). Documents should use either the spatialRegriddingStandardMethod _or_ the spatialRegriddingUserMethod, but not both.

class.name: statistical_model_component
class.description: Creates and returns instance of statistical_model_component class.

attribute.name: timing
attribute.description: Describes information about how this component simulates time.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Describes the type of component. There can be multiple types.

attribute.name: types
attribute.description: Describes the type of component. There can be multiple types.

attribute.name: code_access
attribute.description: Instructions on how to access the source code for this component.

attribute.name: coupling_framework
attribute.description: The coupling framework that this entire component conforms to.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the component.

attribute.name: funding_sources
attribute.description: The entities that funded this software component.

attribute.name: grid
attribute.description: A reference to the grid that is used by this component.

attribute.name: is_embedded
attribute.description: An embedded component cannot exist on its own as an atomic piece of software; instead it is embedded within another (parent) component. When embedded equals "true", the SoftwareComponent has a corresponding piece of software (otherwise it is acting as a "virtual" component which may be inexorably nested within a piece of software along with several other virtual components).

attribute.name: license
attribute.description: The license held by this piece of software.

attribute.name: long_name
attribute.description: The name of the model (that is recognized externally).

attribute.name: online_resource
attribute.description: Provides a URL location for this model.

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: The properties that this model simulates and/or couples.

attribute.name: release_date
attribute.description: The date of publication of the software component code (as opposed to the date of publication of the metadata document, or the date of deployment of the model)

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: The name of the model (that is used internally).

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A free text description of the component version #.

class.name: time_lag
class.description: The coupling field used in the target at a given time corresponds to a field produced by the source at a previous time. This lag specifies the difference in time.

class.name: time_transformation
class.description: The coupling field used in the target at a given time corresponds to a field produced by the source at a previous time. This lag specifies the difference in time.

class.name: timing
class.description: Provides information about the rate of couplings and connections and/or the timing characteristics of individual components - for example, the start and stop times that the component was run for or the units of time that a component is able to model (in a single timestep).

attribute.name: is_variable_rate
attribute.description: Describes whether or not the model supports a variable timestep. If set to true, then rate should not be specified.
